answers.author: [Unknown]
answers.text:
Kevin, 
Thank you for your question.  I found some sources that might be helpful to you.  
The Knowledge Network posted a great article titled Social Media Return on Investment.  It discusses various social media websites, their purpose, and if they are worth investing time in.  Chatter is discussed in comparison to other virtual town halls.  
http://icma.org/en/Article/103299/Social_Media_Return_on_Investment 
Levi Smith on his blog “It’s Worth Noting” wrote a comparison of Yammer vs Chatter.  
http://www.itsworthnoting.com/reviews/comparison-of-free-yammer-v-chatter/
Social Media Delivered posted an article about Chatter.com.
http://www.socialmediadelivered.com/2011/03/23/chatter-com-a-file-sharing-platform-worth-talking-about/
CIO posted an article on the collaboration platform and its benefits despite the workflow disruptions.  
http://www.cio.com/article/732561/Why_It_s_Time_to_Embrace_Chatter_and_Put_Skepticism_Aside
I hope these sources were helpful to you!  Don’t forget to check back  to the Knowledge Network topics pages for Process Improvement and Organizational Culture for more information relating to your questions.  
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/topics/kn/Topic/183/Organizational_Culture
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/topics/kn/Topic/209/Process_Improvement
Hilary Badger
Knowledge Network Intern
ICMA

answers.author: Gregory Stopka
answers.text:
Hi Kevin,
From what I've seen, enterprise social media like Chatter is a growing trend in local government.  Two governments that have fully implemented Salesforce are Elgin and Palo Alto.  I've attached an article the Alliance wrote on Elgin's use of Chatter during the flooding crisis a few months ago.  I hope this helps.

author: Kevin Leighty
text:
I am doing research on the product Chatter by SalesForce. I have heard that it can be used to develop interdepartmental relations and break down "silos" in an organization. It looks like this product is geared mostly for the private sector, but some municipalities do use it.
I just wanted to see if anyone had any experience with this product or know certain things about it's effectiveness. The product can be found here: http://www.salesforce.com/chatter/features/ 
Thanks!
title: Chatter
